newsitem.title: JAPAN: PRESS DIGEST - Top Japan business news - April 1.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - Top Japan business news - April 1.

text.p: Following are some of the leading stories in the Japanese press on Tuesday, as reported by Kyodo news agency:
-- Hokkaido Takushoku Bank Ltd and Hokkaido Bank Ltd plan to merge next spring.
-- Prime Minister Ryutaro Hashimoto will seek revision of law on Okinawa land leases for U.S. military forces.
-- Three non-banks affiliated with Nippon Credit Bank Ltd (NCB) are expected to be liquidated.
-- Consumption tax increased to five percent starting today.
-- Prime Minister Hashimoto is not considering talking about a cut in members of U.S. Marine Corps in Japan in his planned talks with U.S. President Bill Clinton.
-- NCB plans to cut 600 employees in bid to remove itself from business quagmire.
